course_title: Special Topics in African American Studies: Black Ecology Culture
class_notes: This course examines people of African descent ways of being within the natural environment. We will use books, articles, videos, and artwork to examine Black environmentalism, the cultural use of landscapes, plants as material culture, environmental racism, and trauma in natural environs. This course engages students in a conversation about cultural development, ecological engagement, people and plant interaction, social and environmental justice efforts around access to land, Black land ownership, and sustainable food sources. The course would include guest speakers involved in advocacy work around the preservation of Black agrarian cultures.
course_description: Wide range of topics pertinent to the African American experience.
